title: How to Reset or Change Your Voicemail Password on an iPhone: Step-by-Step

steps.title: Open your iPhone’s Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone’s Settings. It’s a gray app that contains gears and is on your home screen.

steps.title: Tap Phone.
steps.content: Tap Phone . It’s in the fifth section of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Change Voicemail Password.
steps.content: Tap Change Voicemail Password . It’s the third section of the menu.

steps.title: Enter a new password.
steps.content: Enter a new password. Use the numeric keypad that appears on your screen. The password must contain 4-7 digits.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's in the upper right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Re-enter the new password.
steps.content: Re-enter the new password. Be careful to enter it exactly as you did the first time.

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's in the upper right corner of the screen. Now, if you are ever prompted to enter your password when checking voicemail (if you're checking from another phone, for example) you must use the password you just set. When checking voicemail from your iPhone, your device automatically sends the password to your carrier, so you typically don't have to enter it.
